ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Tinnitus secondary to barotrauma
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Onset of symptoms occurred during a flight with significant pain and pressure; tinnitus perception shifted laterality following PE tube placement, suggesting central involvement.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Mixed hearing loss (Right Ear)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Developed following PE tube placement for barotrauma, characterized by an air-bone gap and patent tube volume.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Sensorineural hearing loss (Bilateral)
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Underlying mild high-frequency sensorineural loss present at baseline.

ordered_list.rationale_short: To assess outer ear and tympanic membrane status following barotrauma.
To evaluate middle ear function and pressure.
To determine degree and configuration of hearing loss.
To assess speech reception and word recognition abilities.
Follow-up post-ENT intervention to check PE tube status.
To confirm patency of the PE tube.
To monitor hearing thresholds post-tube placement.
Tinnitus evaluation (pitch/loudness match, MML, residual inhibition).

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Baseline evaluation following airplane barotrauma revealed normal otoscopy and Type A tympanograms. Audiometry showed normal sloping to mild sensorineural hearing loss bilaterally with absent acoustic reflexes. Tinnitus was reported in the left ear.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Clear ear canals and normal tympanic membranes bilaterally.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Type A bilaterally (Right: -2 daPa, 1.3 cc; Left: -2 daPa, 1.4 cc).

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Normal sloping to mild sensorineural hearing loss bilaterally. Negative Stenger at 3000 Hz.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 15 dB HL bilaterally; WRS 100% at 60 dB HL bilaterally.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up 1 month later after ENT placed a PE tube in the right ear. Tinnitus perception shifted to be louder in the right ear. Right ear showed mixed hearing loss with a patent PE tube (large volume flat tympanogram). Left ear remained stable.

tests.name: Otoscopy
tests.result_summary: Right ear: tube and debris visible. Left ear: unremarkable.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Flat (Type B) with large ECV (8.9 cc), consistent with patent PE tube. Left ear: Normal (Type A).

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Mixed loss with 20 dB threshold decrease and air-bone gap at 250 Hz. Left ear: Stable SNHL.

tests.name: Speech audiometry
tests.result_summary: SRT 20 dB HL bilaterally; WRS 100% at 60 dB HL bilaterally.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: 6-month follow-up. Patient reported low-frequency narrowband noise in the right ear and 'cicadas' in the head. Tinnitus evaluation characterized the right ear tinnitus.

tests.name: Tympanometry
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Large volume flat tympanogram consistent with patent PE tube.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Right ear: Pitch match 500 Hz (narrowband noise); Loudness match 45 dB HL; MML 60 dB HL (white noise); Residual inhibition present but brief.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up after fitting with right-only hearing aid/masker. Patient reported 'unmasking' phenomenon where suppressing the right-sided tinnitus made the left-sided tinnitus perceptible again.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Patient reported right ear tinnitus was more 'mellow', but she was now able to hear tinnitus in her left ear.

proposed_items: Referral to Otolaryngologist (ENT) for medical management
Antibiotic drops (prescribed by ENT post-tube insertion)
Binaural masking/sound enrichment (trial/demo hearing aid on left ear added to right device)
counseling_actions: Explain that tinnitus involves the central auditory system and not just the ears
Discuss the phenomenon of 'unmasking' where treating only one ear allows the brain to focus on tinnitus in the untreated ear
Recommend binaural sound enrichment to prevent shifting perception
Personal adjustment counseling regarding tinnitus management strategies

red_flags_present: Sudden onset of pain and pressure in the ear (barotrauma)
Sudden onset tinnitus associated with trauma

escalation.rationale_short: Medical evaluation of barotrauma and management of middle ear status (PE tube placement).

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor changes in hearing sensitivity and tinnitus, and adjust masker settings.

expected_outcome: Amplification was turned off and masker settings were extensively changed for patient comfort.
A trial/demo hearing aid was fitted on the left ear with a tinnitus masker (in addition to using the device already fitted on the right ear).
Initial findings in clinic were positive, with the patient reporting her tinnitus seemed completely 'dulled out'.
